top_comment.text:
The real problem here is that you have to wait hours to vote: In germany it 
takes me less than 5 minutes to vote. The actual process takes much less 
time: 30s checking if you are eligible to vote, 30s to give you all 
required paperwork, 30s to make your cross at the desired party/parties 
(you have two votes) and 30 seconds to put the form in the box. Why does it 
take 6 hours to cast a vote in the US? Don't you have to do other things on 
that day?﻿
top_comment.author: creutzwald1105

comments.text:
+creutzwald1105 From what I understand not all states allow voting by mail, 
and there is a process required before you are eligible to vote by mail, I 
believe you can only vote by mail during early voting as well. Majority of 
young people don't care about voting, and I think older people don't trust 
voting through mail so the younger generation don't know it's a option.
comments.author: Ziru322

comments.text:
+Ziru322 Okay that's not a problem in Germany as votes are always on 
Sundays, where most people don't need to work and it is possible to vote 
earlier in person in your city hall or via (snail) mail. I googled that it 
is possible in all US states to vote via mail, so why aren't people using 
that if they have instead wait hours to vote?
comments.author: creutzwald1105

comments.text:
This is not some conspiracy theory there are many more voting booths in the 
rural mostly republican counties versus the urban and suburban counties at 
voting season. It has been orchestrated this way for the past decade by the 
new extremists Republican party, and they have no problem with this 
campaign being known.
comments.author: Ziru322

comments.text:
Yes, people need to work so they can pay off their medical bills, and/or 
student loans. Either working for a "temporary" employement company or 
finding two part-time jobs because many companies don't hire full time so 
they don't have to provide benefits requires between 40-80 hours a week to 
live paycheck to paycheck. Taking days off will make your employers think 
you're lazy or uninterested of your shitty jobs so hours get cut resulting 
in you either being homeless, in prison, or dead. This is what the wealthy 
want, and their puppet Republican politicans strive to make it 
harder/impossible for the middle class and poor who are mostly Democrat to 
cast a vote.
comments.author: Ziru322

top_comment.text:
6 hour wait to vote... the US really is like the third world. I bet they 
don't wait 6 hours in those nice white middle-class areas﻿
top_comment.author: 2001Horatio

comments.text:
+AnarchoFeminist same here it's such a disgrace and I think any politician 
found orchestrating this should be charged with treason.
comments.author: Ziru322

comments.text:
My area is strictly republican, I have literally never had to wait for a 
booth. I go in, I sign my name, I vote, I stop at the bake sale for a 
cookie, I go out.
comments.author: AnarchoFeminist

comments.text:
+Ronald Biggs That's just the way Conservatives are... real Democracy and 
real Freedom just don't sit right with them.
comments.author: 2001Horatio

comments.text:
You only have to wait 6 hours to vote in minority areas of town. The 
Republicans have set it up this way because they know most people in these 
areas will vote Democrat.
comments.author: Ronald Biggs

comments.text: +xinecal law Oh no!!!! Don't go, pleeeeeeasssseeeee! I value your opinion.
comments.author: 2001Horatio

comments.text:
+2001Horatio So this is the limit of your cognitive abilities? Very well! 
Have a nice day!
comments.author: xinecal law

comments.text: +xinecal law Mmmmmmnooooooo, it's just the only comment you deserve! LOL
comments.author: 2001Horatio

comments.text:
+2001Horatio Is that really the only thing you could come up with? * *shakes 
head* *
comments.author: xinecal law

comments.text:
+xinecal law
To summarize your comment: you ARE third world.
comments.author: 2001Horatio

comments.text:
We are not a third world. The 6 hour wait was for nothing but politics. A 
certain political party has trouble winning elections when too many people 
go vote. The long wait times are done on purpose to discourage voters. It 
turned taking around an hour to leave work to vote to possibly having to 
take the ENTIRE day. How the hell republicans doing this is not criticized 
by their party members is beyond me. I am NOT talking about voter ID, I 
have no issue with the ID requirement. The issue is the closing of numerous 
places to go vote, fewer or elimination of Same-Day Registration, decrease 
early voting days. Which means voters are being screwed out of their time 
because up to twice as many people could show up thus increasing voters in 
line. This is one of the reasons why our country is screwed up. Politicians 
should not be doing this crap, its suppose to be fair & equal access to 
voting facilities.

Great example is Ohio’s Secretary of State Republican Jon Husted for the 
2012 election. This guy went around extending hours for voting republican 
counties, while blocking democrat counties from doing the same. Along with 
a lot of other things that are disgraceful. But here is the kicker.  It 
took a FEDERAL JUDGE to order him to extend voting hours because Jon Husted 
is so unethical, immoral & un-American that he could not see what he was 
doing was WRONG!
comments.author: xinecal law

comments.text: Yes, we do.
comments.author: Hen's Tooth Wilderness Outfitters

comments.text: You hit the nail on the head there
comments.author: Exo Genesis

top_comment.text:
This is about as bad as MSNBC making fun of Sarah Palins Black adopted 
Grandchild﻿
top_comment.author: Justin Beck

comments.text: +DollnAbox  I guess its just a matter of preception
comments.author: Justin Beck

comments.text:
Absolutely! I totally agree with that, never said I didn't. MSNBC is 
basically the "liberally channel". My point is that Fox is a lot meaner, 
basically. They are a LOT more hateful with the things they say. They are 
big bullies. MSNBC pokes light hearted fun at people who they think are out 
of touch (Rachel Maddow does this a lot) or don't agree with, but Fox is 
always perpetuating stereotypes and making truly mean and unneccesary jabs 
often at innocent people like this 102 yr old lady. *Way* more than MSNBC. 
That was my point.
comments.author: DollnAbox

comments.text:
+DollnAbox  If you cant admit that MSNBC  has a huge Liberal Bias, You need 
to research the facts.
comments.author: Justin Beck

comments.text: I don't agree, but let's just agree to disagree. :-)
comments.author: DollnAbox

comments.text:
+DollnAbox MSNBC is Just as bad as FOX. Its just the Liberals version of 
Fox but, this series is ran by mostly Liberals so, they ignore those cases
comments.author: Justin Beck

comments.text:
+Justin Beck
I agree that was very wrong, but can you really compare that to the truly 
nasty and hateful things Fox says almost every single day? They are *always* 
making fun of *anyone* who is not within their circle or shares their 
views. They are truly bullies.
comments.author: DollnAbox

comments.text:
+DollnAbox The show said One of these dont fit. And the host and everyone 
laughed.
comments.author: Justin Beck

comments.text:
That was Mitt Romney's black adopted grandchild, and MSNBC didn't make fun 
of him, a guest on the Melissa Harris-Perry show said something to the 
effect of them using the baby as a token. They didn't make fun of the baby 
himself. However, she did apologize, (in tears) even though it was a *guest* 
saying that crap. I agree it was despicable, but FOX never apologizes for 
anything no matter how despicable.
comments.author: DollnAbox

top_comment.text:
I do think they put a bit too much attention on her honestly. There were 
plenty of other people that waited on line too, but they don't get 
mentioned. I'm sorry, but I don't think "being old" deserves tons of 
attention.

Let's put it this way. She's old, and stood in line to vote. Well, being 
old doesn't suddenly make you deserving of being on TV and news and 
stuff..you're old, big deal. As for standing in line, as I said, a lot of 
people did. People stand in lines all the time, sometimes longer than 
that..so..I really don't see a reason her standing in a line was a huge 
deal. Old or not.

Don't get me wrong, I have nothing against the woman, or people of any age, 
I just don't think being old is a big deal. "I haven't died yet and I stood 
in a line"...grats?﻿
top_comment.author: TXF

comments.text:
Also its not about voting for the person you think will change the world 
it's about voting for the asshole you think will do the least damage. A 
politicans main goal is to get reelected sure they can shit on their own 
promises and persona that they campaigned with, but it decreases their 
chances for reelection. Voting is important especially state and county 
voting. If you do vote at least their's a chance that you and those similar 
to your mindset make a difference in the society you live, or you don't but 
at least you now have the right to bitch about government policies.
comments.author: Ziru322

comments.text:
Obama is showing this persons story so that those who are to lazy to vote 
and those in blue counties who have to wait hours to vote because of 
Republican tactics to take her determination as example and follow suit. 
She's 102 years old you idiot if she really did stand for 6 hours straight 
she's lucky to have not died in line.
comments.author: Ziru322

comments.text:
+txfnero At first sight of your paragraph, I thought that you were being a 
bit of a twit... but now I see your point in a way. I mean... she voted. 
That's it. Nothing else in the matter. How is this so rewarding? If I was 
cursed to live that long through a period of stricken poverty and endless 
oppression, I wouldn't give two thoughts about who's running for president 
or any other campaign actually. To be honest... I would be ashamed of 
myself for falling for all of this "Donkey V.S. Elephante" nonsense to 
begin with. Whether the position for head office goes to a Democrat, a 
Republican, or even a Whig since everyone's obviously living in the past, 
the results will still remain the same... HORRIBLE!!! The president doesn't 
even have full power over the country in which he's running... but since I 
don't expect many if not anyone at all to be open about this situation, I 
really have nothing else to say.
comments.author: Rennis Jackson

comments.text:
FYI: US population of people over 100 y/o is a little over 100,000. That 
comes down to 0.03144%. You would need to multiply 0.03144 by 32 just to 
get to ONE percent. So that makes her refusal to leave without voting a 
notable accomplishment.
comments.author: xinecal law

comments.text:
+txfnero How about simple respect for elders? Often they are frail, and 
many times ill. How about compassion? Would you think it was "no big deal" 
if your grandma was in a six hour long line in the heat or cold? Would you 
tell her "Big deal grandma, shut the hell up about it, who cares that 
you're old"?
comments.author: DollnAbox

comments.text:
+TheJimmie777 man, that's a horrible outlook towards the elderly. just 
because someone is old doesn't mean they're useless, you'd be amazed at 
some of the stories i heard growing up *"stories about the times and events 
they lived through, the hardships, and the moments of happiness"* when i 
was younger my mom volunteered at a retirement home for a couple of 
summers, there was this one guy in particular at the retirement home was 
cool as hell he would tell me about his days living in france during ww2 in 
the french resistance, although it was hard to understand him sometimes 
because of his french accent, some of the things he told me about left an 
indelible impact.
comments.author: SofaKingWeTodEd666

comments.text: You must work for Fox News since you have the 'whats the big deal' attitude!
comments.author: xinecal law

comments.text:
+txfnero If you don't get it..OK. Some folks are best left where they are. 
If you can diminish the scope of experience this lady has had for over a 
century into "living a long time is no big deal" and "all she did was get 
old", you show a lack of depth that hopefully you will overcome. I'm 
assuming you're White and young because you genuinely don't seem to get 
what everyone is trying to convey regarding the significance of this 
woman's journey through life. Hold on to that simplistic, unsophisticated 
point of view and you will continue to not see the forest because all of 
those trees are in the way.
comments.author: TheJimmie777

comments.text:
Does your back hurt, do your knees hurt, do you have arthritis? Let's make 
you stand for five hours.
comments.author: LusciousDuchess

comments.text:
+txfnero you do know she lived through the civil rights era, when she 
wouldn't be allowed to vote right? she's walking history, kid.
comments.author: LIGHTNINGxPUNK

comments.text:
+txfnero
see, what we have here is a wet behind the ears kid who has probably never 
done a hard days work in his life!! shits been handed to you...never stood 
in line except maybe to get something to eat in school....i can tell by the 
b.s. you're stressing!!
comments.author: 7000ironman

comments.text:
+gardedog Why would I complain about my feet hurting? If they hurt, they 
hurt, no need to complain..

Besides that, maybe I'm just missing something. She's old. Woopdy-doo. 
Getting old is literally a matter of existing. "Don't Die" is how you 
become old. It happens. Everyone single person on the entire planet has the 
ability to become old and stand in a line. I see no reason why such a 
simple and easy to do thing should be news worthy.

I see no reason to treat people differently based on their age. Simple 
differences, obviously. I can't treat a 2 year old kid the same as I would 
a big ass 30 year old guy. But I also see no reason why we should put the 
30 year old guy on the news for doing something a 2 year old could do.
comments.author: TXF

comments.text:
i hope for fucks sake your just trolling.... and that you are still very 
young and ignorant and i hope you live long enough to experience and suffer 
through every horror imaginable to man.... you are part of whats wrong with 
this planet.... im gunna make an assumption that you would be the kinda 
person that would complain to no end that your feet hurt from standing in 
line to long at the supermarket
comments.author: gardedog

comments.text:
+hrsqsiest  Yeah but then again, some people don't care. Personally, I 
don't care who the president is, as long as they end up doing a decent job 
at it. I find voting to be semi-pointless to be honest. They can promise 
anything they want to promise, but there's no telling what they're going to 
actually do once they become president. So what's the point of voting on 
something, when you don't even know how that something's gonna turn out. 
It's literally "Vote for one of these people. They could do what they say, 
or not. It's up to them." You're pretty much just voting for whichever 
person you hope will actually do what they promise. Which only works a 
small percentage of the time anyway.
comments.author: TXF

comments.text:
The whole point here is to show that even at 102 years old, she took the 
time to do her part and participated in the democratic process of voting. 
Many of those who are less than half her age didn't vote because they 
couldn't be bothered to wait in line. She should stand as an example of 
what it means to be a citizen of the United States.
comments.author: hrsqsiest

comments.text:
+james price People are getting so bothered by my comment. Like I said, I 
have no problem with the woman. She's probably a nice lady. I just don't 
understand why they're making a big deal out of an old person standing in 
line. Plenty of old people stand in lines. I understand it was a line to 
vote, but that's not even the point. The point is, they're cheering for 'an 
old person that stood in line'. Old people stand in lines all the time, 
it's not a new concept.

Besides that, they shouldn't be cheering that she stood in line. They 
should be annoyed that people didn't let her cut in line to go sooner. She 
shouldn't have HAD to stand in line that long in the first place. But even 
if she did..it's just a line. I don't see the big deal. "Omg she's so 
amazing, she stood in a line." It sounds stupid for a reason.
comments.author: TXF

comments.text: +txfnero iic there's any justice in the world you won't get much older.
comments.author: james price

comments.text:
+mberg1974
damn!!  well said!!
comments.author: 7000ironman

comments.text:
+txfnero
There are far too many americans who don't vote, and that is a huge 
democratic problem. But here we have an example of a 102 year old black 
woman who waited in line for several hours to vote. Black people vote less 
often than white people, and poor people vote less often than rich people.

If she managed to vote so can everybody else. That is the message, get it?
comments.author: mberg1974

comments.text:
+txfnero
ooohhh...... i get your point alright.......
comments.author: 7000ironman
